title: Sri Lanka stocks slip over 3-pct in mid-day trade
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock market slipped over 3 percent within the first hour of trade on Monday (06) as the economical uncertainties grows with speculation about another fuel hike.
The main All Share Price Index fell 2.68 percent or 215.51 points to 7,839.26 at 1130 hrs.
“There’s a bit of uncertainty as to the agreement on the 21st Amendment, budget and the IMF discussions. All those things are a bit dicey,” a top market analyst said.

“We need to get all those on track. The market feels there is not sufficient communication on the IMF program while the global oil prices are moving up, there could be a fresh series of fuel hikes, thereby triggering commodity prices.”
The most liquid S&P SL20 too fell 3.71 percent or 98.31 points to 2,549.36.
Sri Lanka’s inflation in April is already at 39.1 percent and if it moves beyond 50 percent the country will be facing hyperinflation.
Top losers in the first hour are LOLC Holdings, Expolanka and Browns investment. (Colombo/June06/2022)
